intro: Pelea fauriei, commonly known as the Faurie's pelea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Pelea fauriei thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
